author: felixweber
title: After Town Hall by Catalyst Swarm
description: タウンホールには、カルダノのエコシステムに深く関わる参加者が参加します。彼らは、ディスカッションやネットワーキングのためのモデレートされたスペースを必要としています。

f6_assessments.q0:
提案者は、明らかにカルダノコミュニティの利益を第一に考えています。タウンホールイベントの後にリードすることは、より多くのコミュニティを構築するための素晴らしい方法です。なぜなら、個人が同じような興味を持つ人と会うことができ、それが将来的な提案の可能性につながるからです。Cardano Catalystプロジェクトを継続的に発展させていくためには、認知度を高めることが重要です。ですから、投票者と提案者が交流できる場を提供することは、この課題に沿ったものです。
ひとつ疑問なのは、提案者が言っていたマーケティング戦略についてです。提案者がどのような戦略を期待しているのかが不明です。提案者がどのようなマーケティング戦略をとるのか、より具体的な情報を提供していただければ、有権者はこの提案のインパクトをよりよく理解することができるでしょう。(与えられたスコア: 4)
f6_assessments.q1: 提案者は、2021年の夏以降、カルダノのアフター・タウンホール・イベントを成功裏に導いており、それらはすべて成功しています。これらのイベントは過去にうまくいっているので、提案者がこの提案書で説明している変更を実行して、アフター・タウンホール・イベントを改善できると確信しています。提案書に記載されているデータや情報を考慮すると、提案者がこの提案に真摯に取り組むことは明らかである。(評価者：5)
f6_assessments.q2: 提案者は、提案の進捗状況と成功を監査するのに十分な情報を提供している。重要業績評価指標は、カルダノコミュニティが提案の進捗状況を確認できるよう、十分に具体的なものとなっている。例えば、タウンホールイベント後のタウンホールリテンション80％という指標は、提案の成功を観察するために正確に追跡することができる。提案者は、すでに過去のアフター・タウンホール・イベントの指標を追跡しており、今後も継続して追跡する予定です。また、提案者は、プロジェクトの開始時期（2022年1月～2022年3月）と予算の概要を明確に提示している。(与えられたスコア：5）

f6_assessments.q0: アフター・タウン・ホールは、コミュニティによって始められたタウン・ホールの既存の機能で、コミュニティだけでなくタウン・ホールにも価値を与え続けています。これは、コミュニティ自身によって開かれた部屋の数や種類の増加によって測ることができます。これらのAfter Town Hallでは、Catalyst Schoolの様々なワークショップや、様々な分野の新参者を惹きつける様々なトピックをカバーするディスカッショングループ、さらには自分の提案について話したり宣伝したりする提案者のディスカッショングループなどが行われています。かつてはタウンホールの一機能に過ぎなかったものが、今ではタウンホールのメインアトラクションになっているのではないだろうか。この提案が、課題設定のほぼすべてに効果的に答えていることは間違いない。
f6_assessments.q1: 提案者は、カルダノコミュニティの中でも特に価値の高い人物であり、互いにサポートし合う優秀な人材のネットワークを構築している。提案者は、時折、個人が集まり、共通の話題を通じて自分を成長させるためのコミュニティの場を一貫して作ってきた。Catalyst Swarm、Catalyst School、After Town Hall、Eastern Town Hallはすべて提案者の製品である。それに加えて、明確なOKRとKPIを伴う実証済みの実施計画があるため、この提案書は彼らの実現能力に対する信頼を高め続けている。しかし、予算の内訳にはさらに詳細な説明が必要であり、特にテストされる新機能である報酬システムの研究については、さらに詳細な説明が必要である。報酬システムとは何か、それがどのようなコンセプトで機能するのか、まだ明確に定義されていません。また、この提案が直面する可能性のある課題やリスクに関する評価もなされていません。例えば、「報酬システムの導入により、プロジェクト・カタリストからの資金を超えた持続可能性をどのように達成できるのか？そのため、このセクションの提案は星4つの評価にとどまっています。
f6_assessments.q2: マイルストーンを伴う明確なロードマップには、数値目標を伴うOKRとKPIが適切に組み合わされており、この提案の監査を可能にしています。問題提起と解決策の間に明確な関連性があり、提案者は強力な提案を具体化することができた。

f6_assessments.q0:
このチャレンジの重要な点は、多様なコミュニティを促進し、その特徴である高いエンゲージメントと協調的な問題感知、強力な実行チームを奨励することです。After Town Hallsを運営するCatalyst Swarmは、Town Hallミーティングの後に休憩室を設けることで、Catalystのイベントに関するさらなる対話とコラボレーションを促進することを提案しています。

このチームは、これまでに20回のAfter Town Hallsを開催し、数百人が参加し、Youtubeで2000～4000回再生された実績があることを考えると、休憩室をホストするという彼らのさらなる提案は、カルダノコミュニティからの明確なニーズに基づいていると考えられます。小規模でより専門的かつ合理的な会話を開催することで、潜在的に高い技術を持っているが時間に余裕がなく、何時間もフィルターを通さない会話をすることができない人たちの幅広い参加を促し、カルダノコミュニティに技術と価値を付加することができます。


提案されている分科会室は、間違いなくコミュニティを一つにまとめ、有意義な参加を促し、コミュニティの仲間とのつながりを深め、コミュニティのアクティブなメンバーと会うことで自分のネットワークを増やす機会を作ります。

Catalyst Swarmは、このブレイクアウトスペースをオープンプラットフォームとし、カルダノコミュニティのメンバーがブレイクアウトルームのホストとして登録することを推奨しています。これにより、談話が促進され、参加者が増え、既存の会話に参加するだけでなく、自分で会話を始めたりホストしたりすることができるようになり、コミュニティが多様化し、カルダノコミュニティの中からリーダーシップを発揮できるようになります。
f6_assessments.q1:
このチームの実績、コミットメント、継続的な関与を考えると、ブレイクアウト・ルームが成功する可能性は高いと思います。Catalyst Swarmは、カルダノの利用や知識、ネットワークを拡大するプロジェクトを数多く手がけてきました。Catalyst Swarmの過去の実績から、このチームの経験がプロジェクトの目的に沿っていると考えられます。しかし、誰が関与しているのか、また彼らの具体的なスキルセットについての具体的な情報がないため、これについて完全にコメントすることは困難です。しかし、評判だけでなく、これまでのAfter Town Hallプロジェクトへの取り組みと実行力から、このプロジェクトが成功する可能性は高いと考えています。

タイムラインは2022年2月から3ヶ月間、タウンホールと並行して実施する予定です。しかし、2000ドルの予算を使ったマーケティングキャンペーンの詳細や、マーケティングキャンペーンを通じて得られる参加者数の増加の目標値などはほとんど示されていません。このため、マーケティングキャンペーンの成功を測ることが難しいプロジェクトとなっています。参加者の増加がこのキャンペーンの最大の関心事であるならば、この時点で具体的な参加者数を記載し、ターゲット市場が誰であるか、またその理由を明らかにして、マーケティングキャンペーンがどのように成功したか、あるいはプロジェクト全体でどのように改善できるかをさらに掘り下げることが有利になるでしょう。


また、予算には「After Town Hall Reputation and Rewarding systemsの研究と実験」として6,000円が計上されていますが、この多額の支出は不明瞭で、企画書のどこにも記載されていないようです。全体の予算の中では比較的高額な支出となっていますが、この予算の重要な部分が詳細かつ具体的に示されていないのは残念です。
f6_assessments.q2:
タウンホール後のイベントの頻度を考えると、このプロジェクトの監査可能性が非常に高いという点で、1つの項目について予算を明確にしないことには、多少の猶予があります。コミュニティは毎週、プロジェクトが順調に進んでいることを確認できるだけでなく、カルダノにまつわるイベントや活動に参加し、賛同する機会を得ることができます。


現在のKPIセットは明確で、「After Town Hall」の参加者維持率は80％を目標としています。しかし、前述の通り、マーケティング・キャンペーンによって達成された現在の参加者数と目標参加者数に関するKPIには明確な数字がなく、また、アップロードされた分科会での議論に関する具体的な数字もありません（ただし、これは提案書に記載された目標案から推測されます）。  

配信日は、タウンホールと同様に明確に定義されています。しかし、マーケティングキャンペーンの展開と実行には詳細が不足しており、おそらく1月に開始する必要があり、2月のアフター・タウンホールの開始には時間的余裕がありません。繰り返しになりますが、現在の参加者数と目標参加者数の具体的な測定値や、ターゲット市場、キャンペーンのスタイル、マーケティングキャンペーンが具体的に何を達成しようとしているのかについての詳細がなければ、この時間枠が適切かどうかを判断することは困難です。

f6_assessments.q0:
The Catalyst Swarm - After Town Hall provides space for veteran and new people that active in Project Catalyst to engage more and have some discussion or even getting answer for their question. I think, this is a good forum/place where people could interact and produce better idea for Cardano community.

The key metrics and goal of this proposal also align with the challenge settings. It would like to increase the number of proposal and also active participation from community in the After Town Hall event.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team consists of experience people in Project Catalyst. And they already do this After Town Hall for quite some time now. I've participated in several of the After Town  Hall. Basically, this proposal will be implemented successfully if funded. 

Budget is outlined clearly and broken down properly. And the sum is still reasonable in my opinion. Moreover, the team also include realistic time frame to complete the work that they mention in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmap and milestones for each month are clearly defined in the proposal. In addition, the team describe the targeted problem clearly. And community could track the project progress via their website and also by joining the After Town Hall every week after the Global Town Hall is held.

It would be nice if the team could also include number on how many participants do they have now and by how much do they want to increase it. The rest, I think it's quite clear & easy to be measured accordingly.

f6_assessments.q0: Catalyst Swarms are a great way of supplementing Catalyst content and helps its improvement. I also like Felix's collaboration with other Town Halls so feel this project would assist the community as a whole in this way, as well as the content these Town Halls produce.
f6_assessments.q1: Felix is great at organizing, and capturing feedback in these events. I have seen him in action many weekends and Wednesdays and am confident if he is involved: this project will go well.
f6_assessments.q2: Lots of good info with the spreadsheets and other Google docs. These events are indeed good ways of getting the community involved and to grow it. Community is one of the foundation pillars of Cardano, and I think and feel this proposal will grow the community well.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree with the idea coming from this team as it falls within the scope of the challenge brief. This proposal clearly identifies the problem needing to be solved and articulates it with an understanding solution.
f6_assessments.q1: I agree the proposer provided evidence references links, of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal, links are sufficient and active contacted to relevant people.
f6_assessments.q2: Budget have been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items that is for how many meetups approximately, awesome very much needed and reasonably price to achieve the set goals, given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely ighly engaged participants of Town Hall need a moderated space for discussion and networking. It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by organizing breakout rooms after each weekly Town Hall to discuss current events and to provide space for funded and upcoming projects and ideas.This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by creating  these moderated break out rooms    Key metrics  would be  number of users,  number of breakout rooms, number of participants in each breakout room, number of hosts and organizers. The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge. Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more rooms and events. I can say that this proposal adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 5 star rating
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  have provided ample evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in  hosting Town Hall and After Town Hall events.  The links are sufficient. the proposers are well experienced and competent to do the event. The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is stated. THe team structure is listed and experienced. The budget has not been given in detail. The budget is  reasonable to achieve the set goals. The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required. .Theres a realistic timetable  to complete the work. The proposal gives  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .
Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal. Given experience and plan presented it is not highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 This proposal is detailed and budget is reasonable hence I have given it a 5 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap with milestones.   There are  Metrics such of number of participants and number of B/O rooms.   The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties.The information provided is  sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a  5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I have organized various events and know about the importance of setting them up properly content-wise for them to be successful, so I am confident I can determine whether their concepts are set up in a meaningful manner. Since I am also Participating in catalyst since several funds I am competent to determine what kind of community events could be beneficial. The proposal identifies an important point within the challenge which by adressing it, will bring an immense benefit to the Catalyst community and the Cardano ecosystem; by connecting people from all over the world that are united by the same idea and providing them a space to discuss the current topics of the townhalls and Catalyst in general. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since the swarm is a great multiplicator on many accounts, it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
Felix Weber and the Catalyst swarm are a really active and vital part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt they will be able to successfully enact this proposal. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large part of the community as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is without a doubt a perfect example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: A well-defined roadmap with relatable, detailed milestones is presented. Auditable Metrics and KPIs are presented that define the success of the proposals.A clear, understandable problem description is supplemented by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe this proposal can be summed up well in the phrase: "Offering an open stage for the community also allows us to meet, speak and discuss topics and themes that are important to us and our community." The objective here is to promote post Town Hall meetings, to discuss specific issues, debate on funded projects or projects that are yet to be launched. It is interesting how the authors explain the functioning of After Town Hall, both for guest and presenter. This makes us understand the activity developed more completely. The question would be, then improve something that already exists, according to the points raised - timestamp, implement reward systems, promote marketing and so on. In my honest opinion, the 25k requests could be used to create new projects, After Town Hall has been in existence for a few months now and works well in the current way, I believe the goal of promoting debate and connections between engaged members of the community is already being achieved without such improvements, so I don't think this proposal would have that much impact. The Catalyst Swarm group has already had a lot of impact on the objectives of the challenge of promoting a meeting and reflection on the projects/technologies of the ecosystem in the current model, and the funding could give other projects a chance to be born.
f6_assessments.q1: Catalyst Swarm is already a well-known/consolidated group in our community. Because they already have a working history and have already started After Town Hall before, a lot of confidence in the group's ability to carry out this project is conveyed. However, it would be interesting for the team to provide a short description of each member, so that we can know their names, functions and a brief résumé of what they have done so far (inside and outside the Cardano community). About the script, it is very simple, the authors indicate what would be done in general next year and specifically in February and March. But would the project focus on two months? Who would do what, in what period of time, in weeks, to achieve the proposed objectives? I don't know if the rest of the script has yet to be completed or that's it, but it gives the impression of being very dry, so there is not enough detail or length of time for us to fully understand what will be done, how, by whom and and When. About the budget division, I believe it would also need more detail. For example, when asking 6k to research and experiment with the rewards system, what is the justification for this amount? How would this research be worked out, what would be researched, who would research it? How much reward would each person receive, individually? Overall, I believe that both the team presentation, script and funding are explained quite superficially, lacking more detail for a satisfactory understanding of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: I think this is the most complete part of the proposal. The authors provide us with several topics that would serve as content to be followed for auditability, such as holding 5 rooms after Town Hall, 80% retention (this portion is very high and optimistic) of the general meeting participants for the After Town Hall and etc. All of this could be directly monitored by the meeting participants themselves, we could select some members who were not members of the group but who had a commitment to regularly participate in the Town Halls, to, according to their interests, enter the rooms. The Catalyst Swarm Group itself could provide feedback through infographics to be presented during the Town Hall's own progress. Therefore, I believe that the team was concerned with providing content to exercise auditability in a satisfactory manner.

f6_assessments.q0:
this proposal opens an opportunity for public discussions as well as allows new Cardano members to learn and express their ideas/thoughts publicly. This is a great way to expand the Cardano community as well as engage the Cardano ecosystem members. 
Town Hall event is attracting a lot of active and highly engaged community members and therefore the option to have an option for anyone to create a breakout room creates a great opportunity for everyone to express their thoughts/worries/comments.
f6_assessments.q1: Taking into account that this team has already successfully managed the After Town Hall breakout rooms, they have gathered an impressive experience to deliver a high-quality event. So based on the proposer's solid track record of previous After Town Hall breakout room organization, it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. The requested budget looks small compared to the amount of work they are planning to do as there are some tasks (like video editing) that requires a lot of organizers' time, still, it's doable as they have previous experience on doing these tasks.
f6_assessments.q2: As these are event-specific tasks, then it's quite easy to audit the proposal weekly. the roadmap is easy to understand and detailed. Also, the team has a ready-made reporting system that they have used for previous funds which give insight into the member participation.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is a great idea, very impactful for the growth of Cardano ecosystem and Project Catalyst by organizing breakout rooms for participants of the Cardano community to discuss about current events after every Town Hall. The proposal is completely within the challenge and clearly going to add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal team are Catalyst Community members (fulltime); besides, they have organized the After Town Halls successfully. (This is the scaling up of the funded 'After Town Hall' proposal in Fund6). Therefore, feasibility of the proposal should not be a problem. The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and be reasonable to achieve the set goals. I was a newcomer joining a Town Hall and breakout room after Town Hall, and watched Swarm Youtube videos since I could not arrange the schedule to join live. So I completely agree the proposal is going to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
I strongly agree the proposal is fully auditable since they provide a transparent and understandable process by documents and Swarm Youtube videos. Roadmap with milestones and time horizon are provided clearly. The targeted problem and the solution is described in understandable details.
I would like to ask about section (C) How the After Town Hall works, right above (3) the proposers said: 'Upload the recorded videos on:' (then (3)). Was the team missing something?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is a brilliant idea. The goals align with the challenge settings and if successful will earn Cardano good points.
f6_assessments.q1: From the information provided in the relevant experience section, I believe the team possess the skills and experience needed to implement the proposal (links are provided). The proposer has broken down the budget into identifiable items. The proposal has also got a detailed plan for implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has outlined a roadmap, some key milestones and KPIs for the success of the proposal. The proposer has clearly described the targeted problem.
What is lacking is a detailed timeline for the implementation of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has been achieving huge positive impact on the goals and objectives of the campaign in the past and will continue to be a welcome  development considering the immense benefits of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: In addition to the requisite experience of the team from past event activities, the proposal is well detailed and articulated by providing detailed plans to effectively moderate  and make adjustments when necessary. Therefore in my opinion, the team has the capacity and competence to implement the project successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has provided more than sufficient information and  metrics to assess its progress and performance of the project.

solution: 毎週行われるタウンホールの後に、時事問題について話し合うための休憩室を設ける。資金提供されたプロジェクトや今後のプロジェクト、アイデアのためのスペースを提供する。
experience: 私たちは、Catalyst Communityのフルタイムメンバーとして、2021年6月からAfter Town Hallsの開催を成功させています。
